basics.name: Jaryn Colbert
basics.label: Software Developer
basics.summary:
Jaryn has over seven years of software development experience
    in the Intelligence Community (IC). Her areas of expertise
include metadata modeling, generation, and translation, as well as data
quality improvements related to extraction, transformation, and loading (ETL)
functions. As a developer, Jaryn has served on and led teams aiming to produce
missioncritical data and validate its performance for inter-agency data exchange.
Jaryn’s ability to provide technical expertise while considering wider policy
and business implications has allowed her to act as a liaison between agencies,
authoring software products and documentation that enable IC agencies to produce
secure, consistent intelligence with reduced administrative and maintenance
burdens.

highlights:
Acted as an agency representative to the IC Common Metadata Standards Tiger Team (CMSTT) responsible for
submitting change requests, reviewing draft standards, and coordinating agency responses to drive evolution of the
Office of the Director of National Intelligence (ODNI)’s IC data encoding specifications in accordance with the
customer agency’s mission equities and requirements.

Authored XML-related tools to condition, normalize, validate, and translate data in the ODNI IC data exchange
standards, greatly reducing the number and scope of legacy data migration changes and enabling the customer
agency to meet critical integration deadlines with much fewer resources.

Contributed to development of a Java software library that consolidates data conditioning, validation, normalization,
serialization, and translation functions for easier reuse in downstream IC systems, leveraging Kotlin and Google
Protocol Buffers to more easily make data exploitable by a wider variety of IC ingestion systems.

Configured, developed, and maintained agency XML artifacts and standards, including schemas, vocabularies, and
Schematron business rules, for both inter-agency data exchange and exchange between the agency and the wider IC.

Managed team of 13 in developing Java-based automated generation and validation tools, including the Automated
Metadata Tagging Technologies (AMTT) suite, to extract security markings and discovery metadata from semistructured text on the Information Assurance Metadata team.

Developed metadata specifications on the ODNI’s Data Encoding team, which maintained standards and
specifications for the exchange of XML assets throughout the IC.

Improved user compliance with ODNI standards by developing XSL transforms to ensure XML instances were
conformant with rapidly changing specifications, including a harmonization effort between Department of Defense
and IC discovery standards.

Reduced errors and prevented data spillage by drafting repeatable processes for validation and review of ODNI
products before their release to the IC.

Implemented bug fixes for the High-Availability Web Systems Portal content management system, a Java web
application with ten databases supporting over 30k users, using Struts and JSP.

volunteer.summary:
FIRST fosters interest in science and engineering by teaching
    kids to build, test, and program autonomous robots. At several regional
    championships, Jaryn judged and tallied the scores for the robotics portion
    of the competition, while encouraging FIRST's core values of discovery,
    teamwork, and gracious professionalism.

Black Girls Code encourages young girls from underserved communities
    to explore innovation and technology. Jaryn has participated as a technical
    facilitator for several BGC events, including game development with Scratch
    and mobile app development with AppInventor.

Women Who Code inspires women to pursue technical careers and
    develops the community that will nurture them along their path. Jaryn
    contributed to the redesign of the WWC website for the DC chapter.

awards.title: Agency CIO Integration Awards Nominee
awards.summary:
Received two separate nominations for being a key member of the
    team that architected and implemented an Agency-wide system and service
    redesign. Jaryn was hired specifically for her expertise in XML technologies
    that this effort required, including providing impact assessments, alternative
    implementations, and ultimately the data format translations that allowed the
    client Agency to reduce redundancy while buffering their systems from
    unneccesary changes in other parts of the IC.

awards.title: Performance and Team Award
awards.summary:
Recognized for exceptional delivery demonstrating the system's
    capabilities to client Agency's and IC leadership at a SmartData Community meeting.

    From the nomination: Jaryn 'shared information at the appropriate technical
    level while adeptly handling questions from the audience, affording the team
    the opportunity to  demonstrate all of the tool's key functionality within
    the allotted timeframe; a risk identified early in the process.
    Clients were extremely impressed with the delivery, and interest was so high
    that before the demonstration was over, the team was invited
    back to demonstrate additional capabilities upon completion of future development.'
